page.title: 16HOUSES IN C.W.
page.content: Most of the houses in Chipping Warden are made of tile and brick. Some consist of slate and local stone.Most of the old houses are down Hogg End. The new estates are The Close which contains 15 houses, Allens Orchard, which contains about 20 houses and Arbury Banks which contains 45 houses and these were built just after the Second World War. The oldest house in the village is probably Well Cottage, some some parts of which are thought to be 15th century. There are a few large houses including The Manor and the Court House.
